meanings.definition: To make or become like Prussian in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The tailor prussianised the uniform by adding precise lines and buttons.
meanings.sent2: The artist prussianised her painting by using a strict color palette.
meanings.sent3: The chef prussianised the dish by arranging the ingredients in a military formation.
meanings.sent4: Her room was prussianised with clean lines and minimalistic furniture.
meanings.sent5: The garden was prussianised with perfectly trimmed hedges and symmetrical flower beds.

meanings.definition: To subject to Prussian influence or control.
meanings.sent1: The neighboring country was prussianised after the invasion.
meanings.sent2: The small town was prussianised by the strict laws imposed by the new ruler.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was prussianised with desks arranged in military formation.
meanings.sent4: The company was prussianised under the leadership of the new CEO.
meanings.sent5: The culture of the region was prussianised by the dominant Prussian presence.
